description.narrative: The aim of this programme is to support the Government of Sierra Leone (GoSL) to reduce maternal, neonatal and under-5 mortality and morbidity by increasing utilisation of quality Reproductive, Maternal, Neonatal, Child and Adolescent Health (RMNCAH) services. This will be achieved through a multifaceted approach to strengthen quality, expand access, and build the demand for RMNCAH services in Sierra Leone.

activity-date.narrative: CUAMM- DOCTORS WITH AFRICA UNITE FO SEV LAYF NA SALONE – ACTIVITY SUMMARY QUARTERLY REPORT QUARTER FIVE – JANUARY – FEBRUARY, 2020 MAIN ACTIVITY COMPLETED DURING THE QUARTER ACHIEVEMENT • Coordination of health partners meeting • Five health partner meetings were held this time. Pujehun had 3 and Bonthe had 2. One meeting was not done in Bonthe as the DMO, M&E and other DHMT members were out of the district for support the meetings. • Support to PUH In charges Meting • Six PHU staff in-charges meeting was done this quarter, 3 in Pujehun and 3 in Bonthe. Data presentation done in all the meetings conducted. • Maternal death Investigation • Eleven maternal deaths occurred this quarter. Out of this death, 9 occurred in facility and 1 each in transit and community. Pujehun had 8 deaths and Bonthe had 3 deaths. • Maternal deaths review Meetings completed with action points • Six deaths were investigated and reviewed this quarter. Five of the deaths happened at the end of the quarter and will be reviewed in net next month of next quarter. • Action point developed this quarter on maternal deaths were 41 and 26 was achieved on due date set. The remaining action points is remained to be followed up and if necessary, will be reviewed in future meeting based on its relevance • Support to development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) • Generator SoP is complete. HR and maintenance draft are complete and under review with Cuamm and hospital management for validation. • Non-financial incentives for best performing health facilities on a pre-agreed criterion with the DHMT • In Bonthe and Pujehun, non-financial motivation award was given to 5 & 4 best performing PHUs in the two districts. • Integrated Supportive supervision and other supervisions • There was no ISSV completed this quarter. Two post visit meeting on ISSV was completed for both district this reporting quarter. • Support to Pediatrics and obstetric referrals • This quarter, the national referral form developed by MOHS, WHO and other partners was enrolled to 31 staff from 5 CHCs and 1 hospital in Bonthe and 7 CHCs and 1 hospital in Pujehun. 11 & 20 staff from Bonthe & Pujehun benefited from the training. In addition, staff from UBC Mattru where trained since most facilities in Bonthe refer to this facility. • Obstetric and pediatric referrals done from SLiSL facilities this quarter include; 30 & 23 and 72 & 84 obstetric and pediatric referral for Bonthe and Pujehun districts respectively. CUAMM continued to support obstetric referrals in Riverine facilities not accessible by NEMS ambulance. This period, 54 referrals (Pujehun 16 & Bonthe 36) was completed this quarter • RMNCHA and EmONC trainings conducted • In collaboration with DHMT, CUAMM supported Bonthe DHMT to successfully complete training of 134 health staff from Hospital & PHUs on selected EMONC topics (Ante Natal Care, Management of Post-partum Haemorrhage and Eclampsia) with male 8 and 126 female. • Four days refresher training for 49 PHUs staff (42 females and 7 males) on IMNCI was done in Bonthe. Pre and Post test were conducted before and after the training. The average pre-test score was 27% and post-test 72%. Pujehun had one day training on Manual Vacuum Extraction for 14 CHOs • Mentorship on EmONC and IMNCI • This quarter 27 mentees received mentorship in CUAMM district, 12 in Bonthe and 15 in Pujehun. Bonthe district was challenged with the mentorship program as 2 mentees from the hospital were replaced, two transferred to another district, one sick and all were dropped from the program. Pujehun had one transfer of mentee to a none SLISL facility. However, all the mentees dropped out were replaced in Bonthe. A mentor-mentee review has conducted in both districts • This quarter two of the mentees in one SLiSL facility in Bonthe were competent in BEmONC standard thus abled to score 85% in the cumulative assessment conducted by the end of December. • Blood Donation Activities Supported • This quarter, Bonthe and Pujehun had 100% and 73% of blood representing minimum amount of blood needed on a daily basis in the hospital that will serve the district population throughout the three months. Family replacement and community voluntary drive was done to mobilise blood for the blood bank in the hospitals this quarter. • Pujehun had 67 days of minimum blood availability in the quarter. In March 2020, the blood bank refrigerator broke down resulting in waste of available blood bag. A new temporary fridge was arranged by another donor but Unfortunately, this fridge is not ideal and only a temporary solution. It provides storage for only limited number of blood bags. • DHMT/Hospital Operation support • Daily operational support to DHMTs and Hospital (fuel, generators maintenance, Internet Hospital printing: maternity, pediatric and blood bank charts, PHU: Partograph, referral forms • CUAMM in collaboration with DHMT made a joint visit with key stakeholders comprising of Chiefdom Speaker and Section Chief to Delken and Mania to discuss challenges pose on mentorship in the facilities. The visit was partly successful as the action points developed, if it is address by DHMT, then the Challenge for mentee stationed at Delken in particular will be resolved. • Flexible fund supports • Supported to Bonthe DHMT in the launch of “Hands off our girls’ “campaign by H. E first Lady in Mattru Town Bonthe district • CUAMM supported DHMT to complete a project of minor repairs for 5 non- SLISL supported PHUs (approved flexible fund concept note). PHUs for which this activity was undertaken are: Victoria MCHP, Kabati CHP, Ngepayhun CHP and Mogbewmoh CHC. In Pujehun, four facilitie - Bandajuma, Potoro, Gbondapi, Bumpeh - benefited from rehabilitation using EMONC budget. • Others Activities completed • Chiefdom level CHO Supportive Supervision was done in 7 SLiSL Chiefdom in Pujehun and 5 in Bonthe. CUAMM supported two monthly CHO supervision in Bonthe and one in Pujehun. • Income generating activities initial support on farming in Cassava and ground nut plant was given to six blood donation groups formed in six communities in Pujehun. DHMT and CUAMM jointly provided (Hoe of different sizes, Cutlasses, food for work) as initial kits to the groups as stated in group proposal. These groups are pilot of sustainable body that will support blood donation activities in the district. • In collaboration with DHMT, community engagement meeting with stakeholders comprising of Paramount Chiefs, Women’s Leader, Religious Leaders, FMCs, Youth Leaders, Chiefdom Supervisors, Partners, Media Representatives, Security, PLWs, Council (BDC and BMC) and hospitals (UBC & BGH) on project implementation was held on at Bonthe District Hall (Mattru). • The meeting was held purposely to discuss challenges around Maternal, Child and Adolescence health issues and proffer mitigating measures. This similar meeting was held last quarter in Pujehun. This quarter a follow up on the action points developed by the stake holders were made to ascertain the degree of adherence to the action points developed.
